intro: Podandra, commonly known as the common podandra, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Podandra thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along the edges of streams. It plays an important role in supporting local biodiversity by providing habitat and nectar for various insects.
